title.narrative: Academy of Culinary Arts Cambodia II - kvalificerad yrkesutbildning
Academy of Culinary Arts Cambodia II - vocational training

description.narrative: Insatsen syftar till att konsolidera uppbyggandet av yrkeshögskola av internationell standard för besöksindustrin. Yrkeshögskolan drivs i entreprenadformen Offentlig Privat Samverkan (OPS), representerad av den kambodjanska staten i form av ministerierna för finans, turism och handel och det privata näringslivet i form av besöksnäringens organisationer. Från givarsidan samfinansieras insatsen av Sida och andra biståndsorganisationer.

The intervention consolidates the creation of a vocational institute of international standard for the hospitality sector. The institute is established in the form of a Public-Private-Partnership (PPP), represented by the Cambodian Government in the form of the Ministries of Finance, Tourism and Commerce and the private sector represented by the hospitality sector’s associations.

The primary objective of the intervention is to contribute to the development of a sustainable and equitable labour market, through providing high quality training to young Cambodian men and women. The secondary objective is to provide the hospitality industry with qualified, trained and certified professionals through high quality and innovative educational programmes that ensure that the students possess valuable transferable skills in all aspects of culinary competencies. The intervention consolidates the creation of a vocational institute of international standard for the hospitality sector. The institute is established in the form of a PPP, the public part represented by the Cambodian Government in the form of the ministries of labour, tourism, commerce and education and the private part by enterprises in the hospitality sector.

tag.narrative: 4.4 - By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship.

4.4 - Till 2030 väsentligen öka det antal ungdomar och vuxna som har relevanta färdigheter, däribland tekniska färdigheter och yrkeskunnande, för sysselsättning, anständigt arbete och entreprenörskap.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution, Shift 360: Academy of Culinary Arts of Cambodia II

description.narrative: The period from July 2018 to December 2019 was the first one and a half year of the second phase of the Swedish support to ACAC. In total 215 students studied the full-time courses during 2019, with 108 female and 107 males. Of these 29 students coming from poor background studied on full scholarships, 16 female and 13 males. Half of the time the students conducted their studies as interns at restaurants and hotels, in Cambodia, Dubai, Hong Kong, Singapore, France and Switzerland. The operations of the institution continued from the first phase more or less as planned. An emphasis was put on student enrolment with open house activities, visits to secondary schools and by participating in job fairs. Much attention was also given to marketing of the institution and other promotions to make ACAC known, nationally and internationally. This was seen as very important for the sustainability of the institution in the long term and its ability to attract sponsorships and partnerships. As an addition to the internships ACAC managed the restaurant House of Scott during 2019. The restaurant operated as a normal public restaurant but was also used as a training ground for students. The institution conducted up-skill training for different chefs and cooks form Embassies and others, such as the Royal Phnom Penh Hospital. As a part of the promotion ACAC participated in the TV show MasterChef Cambodia and trained the contestants. The institution also participated in the Slaprea Food Festival and organised the Cambodian part of the Disciples ESCOFFIER Young Chef Competition, sending the winners to the Asian Finals in Hong Kong. One of the outstanding issues was the taxation where the Department of General Taxation was reluctant to follow the instructions from the Ministry of Economy and Finance on reducing taxes for ACAC as an education institution. The Embassy continued to have close contact with ACAC to discuss and find solutions to different issues, such as the taxation, registration and relations to different ministries.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
